model.player

Class SimplePlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.player.SimplePlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SimplePlayerInterface

    public class SimplePlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimplePlayerInterface, java.io.Serializable
    A SimplePlayer object is created to represent an instance of an already created Player object more simply.

    The SimplePlayer object contains the Player object's name, balance, a string representation of the last move they made, and an array of the Option objects the player can perform. This object is used specifically for representing a Player object in the GUI.

    Author:
    Emmet Murray
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SimplePlayer.Move
      Describes a move, in this context a move is a player reacting to the current game state by either folding, checking, calling, betting, raising, or going all-in.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • name

        private final java.lang.String name
        The name of the player, the variable is final once initialized in the constructor.

        The player's name cannot be changed once initialized.

      • balance

        private int balance
        The amount of money the player has left.

      • lastMove

        private SimplePlayer.Move lastMove
        String representation of the Player's last move, created in the inner Move class.

      • options

        private Option[] options
        Array of Options that the player can execute on their turn.

        The options are only updated immediately before the Players turn, this is done to save time by not constantly updating this array.
